intro: Triumfetta actinocarpa, commonly known as the red sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and southern Asia. It is a low-growing shrub with small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in dry environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Triumfetta actinocarpa is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in disturbed or rocky habitats.
